description: Glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) is a short protein that suppresses feeding and helps manage glucose levels in diabetes.  It is encoded by the GCG gene.  This pathway depicts factors in GLP-1 secretion from L cells in the intestine into the portal vein, the primary entry port of digestion products into circulation.  This diagram is based on Figure 2 of [Davis et al.](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9190119/).
title: GLP-1 secretion from intestine to portal vein
